answers.answer: Your body is trying to produce enough blood for you and the little one growing inside. It is normal in the beginning. Try drinking extra water and rest extra as needed.
Yes happened to me it lasted through week 5-6 try standing up slow also.
I had the same thing happen when I was about 8 to 11 weeks. I would just sit down and drink some juice. It would pass in a few minutes.
I just had it happen to me today at the store an im 21 wks 1 day

It's nothing to be concerned about. Like mamaash71707 said, it's due to your body producing more blood than it's used to. Drinking extra water, taking it easy for several minutes, and getting up slowly are all good pieces of advice. If it's really severe, try laying down with your feet slightly elevated.

If you are in early stages of pregnancy it's absolutely normal. You hormones are changing quite quickly and this can cause dizziness. If you were in the final trimester however I would ring your midwife or doctor or go to the hospital because that can be a sign of preeclampsia.

I was dizzy all the time....I didn't even known was pregnant yet but thst was one of the symptoms for me, of course once I knew why I was dizzy it stopped haven't felt any since I was 8 weeks or so....which was pretty close to finding put thst I was gonna be a mommy
Im 29 weeks and been  telling my dr since i was 10 weeks about this problem she told me just drink more water which is craziness  i need answers because  its very scary
This happened to me yesterday also I was cooking dinner for my husband and I got really dizzy for a minute I thought it was pretty normal

question: Does anyone get really dizzy to the point that your vision is kind of blurry?? I'm freaking out. 5wks 5 days. ..should I be concerned?
title: dizzy
